intro: Lupsia galactites var. albiflora, commonly known as the whiteflower lupsia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Leguminosae family, characterized by its pod-bearing fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant features compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its ornamental value is notable due to its delicate blooms and adaptability to various soil types. However, it is less commonly cultivated compared to other members of its genus.
